page.title: 02Chichester Harbour
page.content: Chichester Harbour occupies about 5km of this 12km block, a salt water estuary running from SW to NE, of which app. 4km are sand/mud flats at low tide. A deep water channel runs between Stockers Sand and East Head to the head of the harbour, with narrower channels, Thorney going east of Thorney Island and Bosham running N. opposite Itchenor. Pilsey Island lies SE of Thorney, being joined by a causeway. The harbour is used mainly for sailing though there is some fishing, bass, mullet,plaice and flounders being caught; oysters are dredged. East Head, a sand dune promontory managed by the National Trust, is a popular anchorage for yachts and a pleasant place for picnickers and is also a habitat for sea and shore birds. Coots and herons are seen.
